postsData.name:
Ford Coleman
Ford Coleman
postsData.content:
7 Interview Secrets Nobody Shares
(The real reason you're not getting hired)

Getting the job you want isn't just about skills.

It's about knowing the unwritten rules.

Smart moves paired with insider tricks make all the difference.

Here are the secrets that transform interviews into offers:

1ï¸âƒ£ Crush It Before You Show Up
â†³ Tip: Arrive an hour early to a nearby cafe.
â†³ Trick: Research your interviewer's recent wins.

2ï¸âƒ£ Make Them Remember You
â†³ Tip: Dress one level up from the company style.
â†³ Trick: Copy their energy level and speaking pace.

3ï¸âƒ£ Master The Hot Seat
â†³ Tip: Prepare 5 stories about your best work.
â†³ Trick: Take a 3-second pause before tough answers.

4ï¸âƒ£ Speak Without Words
â†³ Tip: Keep your hands visible on the table.
â†³ Trick: Mirror their sitting position slightly.

5ï¸âƒ£ Turn Tables Like a Pro
â†³ Tip: Ask about their biggest team challenges.
â†³ Trick: Turn their questions into conversations.

6ï¸âƒ£ Handle The Money Talk
â†³ Tip: Know your market value beforehand.
â†³ Trick: Let them name the first number.

7ï¸âƒ£ Leave Them Wanting More
â†³ Tip: Ask about next steps clearly.
â†³ Trick: End with "I'm even more excited about this role".

Remember:
Playing the game well is just as important as having the skills.

Which of these tricks will you try in your next interview?
Let me know in the comments below â¬‡

 Repost if you found this insightful!
 Followfor more!

postsData.name:
Mahmoud Owies
Mahmoud Owies
postsData.content:
Generic advice: Say yes more...Say no more...Say maybe.

Do this thing...Now, do the exact opposite...

VoilÃ ...You made it.

Surrender the outcome...But only focus on it...

Think... Don't think, just do...Make plans...Just roll with it...

I can give you more examples, but you get it.

They're not always wrong...They're not always right.

Advice X or Y or Z may work for millions of people but might not work for you...

The problem isn't the advice itself, the problem is how it's advertised and received...

Claiming that your answer is universal is just not right...

Because when it doesn't work you make people feel like it's their problem...

And they'll think thoughts like...

"There's something wrong with me...I'm not good enough...Why am I always a failure?!"

And they either hate, lose trust, or envy the person who claimed that it's going to work for everyone.

There's no universal solution for everyone's problems... We're all unique...and sure there's some generally acceptable guidelines...but the details are always different.

So, Next time you're giving advice...Try to acknowledge that it may not be the best advice for every human being on earth.

And the next time you receive advice... Don't hate it if it didn't work, it's not a hoax, it just wasn't for you... you'll find something else...far better for you...and more effective.

Because after all...You're awesome...and you deserve the best.

Finally, I realise that this is technically advice, right?
Please note that it's universal, it always works, I'm never wrong.

comments.commentText:
Oflate I have stopped giving advises Mahmoud Owies .

But seriously, this is good news, Sourish, the people who actually care about you will always give you advice when they think you need it most.

postsData.content:
The Future of LinkedIn Marketing in 2025: What to Expect 
As we step into 2025, LinkedIn marketing is evolving faster than ever. Here are a few trends and strategies to stay ahead of the curve:
1ï¸âƒ£ AI-Powered Personalization: LinkedIn is increasingly using AI to provide hyper-targeted content and recommendations. In 2025, leveraging AI-driven tools will allow marketers to craft highly personalized campaigns that speak directly to the unique needs and preferences of your audience.
2ï¸âƒ£ Video Content Takes Over: The importance of video continues to grow, and itâ€™s no longer just about polished content. Authentic, behind-the-scenes videos, live streams, and quick thought leadership pieces are becoming the preferred form of communication. Your audience craves relatability over perfection.
3ï¸âƒ£ Employee Advocacy & Thought Leadership: Brands are focusing more on empowering employees to become brand ambassadors. Sharing their stories, experiences, and expertise can build trust and humanize your brand in ways that traditional corporate messages simply can't.
4ï¸âƒ£ Content That Educates and Adds Value: In 2025, the focus will continue to shift from selling products to solving problems. Educational content that provides value and insights will win over audiences more than ever before. It's not about pushing your productâ€”it's about helping your audience grow and succeed.
5ï¸âƒ£ Interactive Features: Polls, quizzes, and interactive posts are here to stay. These tools will become more advanced, providing deeper insights into audience preferences and allowing for more meaningful engagement.
 Takeaway: To succeed in LinkedIn marketing in 2025, focus on authentic, value-driven content, empower your employees to become brand ambassadors, and embrace the power of AI and interactive engagement. The future is about relationships, not just transactions.
Are you ready to leverage these trends to take your LinkedIn strategy to the next level?

comments.commentText: The shift towards employee advocacy can really humanize brands and add a personal touch.

postsData.commentAdded: Exciting insights! Embracing authenticity and AI will truly redefine our LinkedIn strategies. Lets lead the way in building meaningful connections!

postsData.name:
Rachel Park
Rachel Park
postsData.content:
77% of Professionals Are Burning Out (Deloitte).
7 Shifts to Break the Stress Cycle. 

You're drowning in stress signals.
Your body is screaming for attention.

But you keep pushing through,
amplifying the damage day by day.

The stress keeps mounting,
turning small pressures into crushing weight.

But freedom is closer than you think.

Here are 7 shifts to reclaim control 

1. The Mindset Reset:
 Stop: Seeing stress as your enemy
 Start:  Using stress as your compass

2. The Energy Audit:
 Stop: Pushing through exhaustion
 Start: Tracking your energy patterns

3. The Focus Filter:
 Stop: Attempting to manage everything alone
 Start: Choosing your stress battles

4. The Recovery Protocol:
 Stop: Waiting for burnout to hit
 Start: Building regular recovery

5. The Connection Strategy:
 Stop: Isolating when stressed
 Start: Building support systems

6. The Physical Reset:
 Stop: Ignoring your body's signals
 Start: Honoring your physical needs

7. The Mental Guard:
 Stop: Letting thoughts spiral
 Start: Managing your mind

Managing stress does not need to be reactive.

You can learn to manage it proactively and with intention.

Which one of these will you try this week?


Design inspired by Will McTighe
____

ï¸ Repost to help your network manage stress
 Followfor more on career & wellbeing

comments.commentText: Love this Rachel Park, especially the idea of using stress as your compass rather than seeing it as your enemy. I also like the idea of taking "digital detoxes" to prevent mental overload and reset.

postsData.name:
Alex Turnbull
Alex Turnbull
postsData.content:
A founder's '9-figure exit' went viral on Twitter. Here's the actual math: $686K per year for 7 years of their life

The Reality of a "9-Figure Exit":

- $100M sale price
- $73M to investors (Series A/B/Seed)
- $18M split with co-founders
- $3.3M taxes
- $500K loans
- = $4.8M after 7 years of:
- 65% dilution
- Lost control
- Endless board meetings
- 120 people to manage
- $800K monthly burn
- Constant fundraising stress

The Bootstrap Alternative:

- $5M ARR
- >90% ownership
- $2M/year in pocket
- Team of 10
- No board meetings
- Exit option always there ($30-40M)
- Complete freedom

The truth? A bootstrapped founder makes in 2.5 years what a "9-figure exit" founder makes in 7.

Build for freedom, not exits.

comments.commentText:
This analysis highlights the stark realities behind flashy exits. Real success often lies in sustainable growth and control.  
hashtag
#Entrepreneurship

Hereâ€™s the hidden trap: 
Liquidity â‰  Freedom. 

Many VC-backed founders exit with millionsâ€”only to realize they traded years of control for a payout that a bootstrapped founder could match in passive income.

The real flex?
Owning your time.

Because $2M/year with freedom beats $4.8M after 7 years of stress.

postsData.commentAdded: Such a powerful contrast! It truly highlights the value of ownership and freedom in entrepreneurship. Building sustainably pays off!

postsData.content:
The $200,000 mistake I made as a sales leader:

Walking into a top performer's office, I said, 

"There's going to be things you'll love, and things you'll hate..."

Dead wrong.

Should have said:

"Let's talk about how we can work together to get you where you want to go."

That relationship never recovered.

But it taught me the most valuable lesson I now teach sales leaders:

Trust comes before training.

Process comes before performance.

Listening comes before leading.

Today, when I train sales managers, this is lesson #1.

Because without trust:

â†’ Your top performers resist coaching
â†’ Your process gets ignored
â†’ Your training dollars get wasted

You can have the best sales process in the world, but without trust, it's just another PowerPoint collecting dust.

â€”---------------

postsData.content:
The easiest way for a boss to hide their incompetence? Blame you.

When you succeed -
It is because of their great management skills.

When you struggle -
it's because you are not good enough.

Most donâ€™t even realise their own lack of skill is the real problem.

They never ask, â€œDid I fail as a leader?â€
They assume â€œYou just werenâ€™t good enough.â€

And they slap a label on you: lazy, slow, disorganised, incompetent.

Sound familiar? Hereâ€™s how to know if your boss is setting you up to fail:

1ï¸âƒ£ No Clear Expectations:
Your role feels like a moving target.

2ï¸âƒ£ Lack of Resources:
Youâ€™re expected to win with no resources.

3ï¸âƒ£ Constant Micromanagement:
Every move and decision is second-guessed.

4ï¸âƒ£ Excessive Criticism:
Mistakes are magnified. Wins are ignored.

5ï¸âƒ£ Isolation:
Youâ€™re left out of key meetings and conversations.

6ï¸âƒ£ Changing the Rules:
The goalpost keeps moving.

7ï¸âƒ£ Your Confidence is Crushed:
You start doubting yourself.

Checked off 3 or more? Itâ€™s not just you.

Swipe through the carousel for exact steps to take back control.

 Know someone dealing with this? Tag them below.
 Repost to help others spot the signs and follow me,for career advice that actually helps.

postsData.content:
How to write mobile-friendly posts.

(Save this for later) + save time.

How you write posts matters.
(Most people scroll on mobile)

- No white space? Difficult to read.
- Big paragraphs? People ignore them.

5 tips to write mobile friendly â†“

1. One-liners
2. Add empty space
3. Write Short sentences
4. Arrows â†’ to guide the eyes
5. 54 characters max. (Rule of thumb)

- Make it easy. Make it readable.
- When you write, think structure first.

Are your posts mobile-friendly?
â†’ Yes or No? Drop it in the comments!

P.S. Repost ï¸ so others can format it better!

Follow me,, for more LinkedIn tips.

postsData.name:
Soraya Zidane
Soraya Zidane
postsData.content:
Most of my clients are successful business owners and C-level executives.

High on money.
Low on time.

High on external investments.
Low on internal investments.

One of my male clients used to spend tons of money on designer clothes, high-end watches, and cars.

Another one of my female clients spent significantly on Botox, beauty treatments, makeup, and designer handbags.

 To the outside world, they appeared to have it allâ€”luxury and success;

 â€”but beneath the surface, they were still battling insecurity and a sense of emptiness.

â–¶ Wealth without health is poverty to me.

All these possessions constituted superficial external validation that is perpetual because it remains external. 

(Now donâ€™t get me wrong, money is amazing and it is also there to be spent on things you love but it canâ€™t buy everything!)

Working out consistently transformed
 their mindset,
 body composition,
 and self-confidence.

And eventually led to increased business incomeâ€”something they both hadn't even planned for!

You can have all the designer brands and use all the filters,

 Nothing beats having a fit body, and good health.

 And most importantly NOTHING will ever beat THE RESPECT YOUâ€™LL BUILD WITH YOURSELF for doing the work you know you need to do.

And I know that all of you reading this know exactly what I mean

 Get in shape and youâ€™ll look good in anything,

Not because of the brands you wear but because CONFIDENCE RADIATES FROM WITHIN.

 Fit in jeans and a random t-shirt > unfit in Gucci and Luis Vuitton

Just as you can't purchase a strong relationship but must build it,

The same applies to fostering a connection with your body and confidence.

Stop delaying it.

Start investing in your health today!



If you want more actionable tips on all things health, fitness and mindset, then join 6,500+ others reading my newsletter.

comments.commentText: This â–¶ Wealth without health is poverty to me.  Soraya Zidane

Alexandra Nunez, MBA
postsData.content:
How can you free yourself from negative 
emotionsâ€”at work and home?

Picture this:

You're leading a big project, juggling deadlines,
and just as youâ€™re about to breatheâ€”your child
reminds you (last minute) about a school project.

Your mind races. 

Itâ€™s tempting to reactâ€”snap at your team, get short
with your family, or push through in survival mode.

But if you GIVE IN to frustration:

â†’ Stress spikes.
â†’ Clarity disappears.

If you SUPPRESS it:

â†’ Resentment grows.
â†’ Exhaustion follows.

Neither works.

And over time, these reactions become a
pattern, chipping away at patience,
focus, and emotional resilience.

The solution? Emotional antidotes.

In this case trade Anger â†’ Patience

Pause. Breathe. Shift perspective.

Inspired by Buddhist wisdom, these antidotes neutralize
negativityâ€”just like an antidote counteracts poison.

This is about nurturing these new qualities until
they become integral parts of your being.

The more you practice these shifts, the more
naturally, they replace negative reactions.

Check out the examples in this carousel.

P.S. Which of these antidotes do you already use?

***
Emotional resilience is part of burnout-free living.

comments.commentText:
True freedom from negative emotions isnâ€™t just about mental shifts; itâ€™s about spiritual renewal. Scripture tells us, â€œBe transformed by the renewing of your mindâ€ (Romans 12:2). When frustration, stress, or resentment rise, the antidote isnâ€™t just a mindset shiftâ€”itâ€™s leaning into Godâ€™s wisdom, peace, and grace.

Instead of just trading anger for patience, try this: Surrender the frustration and ask, â€œLord, what are You teaching me in this moment?â€ Because true resilience isnâ€™t just about self-controlâ€”itâ€™s about letting God shape your reactions.
EdnaLyn Harding Beautifully said! True renewal goes beyond just willpower - itâ€™s about allowing Godâ€™s wisdom to reshape how we respond to lifeâ€™s challenges.

 Lead with Purpose

The ability to adapt quickly is essential, especially in these days. Agile leadership focuses on changing mindsets to navigate and drive innovation uncertainty.

Iâ€™ve came across  3 Key Benefits of Agile Leadership:

1ï¸âƒ£ Faster Decision-Making â€“  unlocking new opportunities.
2ï¸âƒ£ Empowered Teams â€“  higher engagement
3ï¸âƒ£ Continuous Improvement â€“  refining processes

and staying ahead of disruptions.

Iâ€™ve observed that being quick in shifting your perspective and embracing change is helping you grow faster but also worry less.


At the beginning of my career, I noticed 3 Gaps Without Agile Leadership:

 Slow Adaptation â€“ Resistance to change
 Fragmented Thinking â€“ Lack of cross-functional collaboration
 Employee Disengagement â€“ reduced productivity

and I did not want these gaps to be part of my path.

I started focusing on Holistic Practices for Agile Leadership:

 Systems Thinking

and adaptability to empower teams to thrive.

Douglas Brown
Douglas Brown
postsData.content: Thanks for sharing Nicole Quinn-Miles.and some great suggestions for improvement. There are many stresses and frustrations for employees in today's workplace. I feel it is always important to also consider non financial factors in job satisfaction and well-being to help improve performance, retention, absenteeism and more. I am referring to trust and quality relationships, interactive two-way communication, recognition and appreciation, work-life balance, career development and growth ... all contribute to mental well being, overall health and success in life.
postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Fostering trust and open communication is key. Investing in employees well-being truly enhances performance and retention!

Robert Hess
Robert Hess
postsData.content:
Weavy and Retool held a remarkable hackathon in late 2024, sparking creativity and innovation among participants. The event focused on developing cutting-edge business collaboration tools that seamlessly blend data, AI, and human interaction.

Weavy's platform empowers developers to swiftly incorporate pre-built features such as real-time chat, file sharing, and dynamic activity feeds into their existing applications. This complements Retool's robust app-building engine, offering a comprehensive solution for enhancing workflow efficiency.

The hackathon not only highlighted the technical prowess of these tools but also underscored the power of collaborative community efforts in driving innovation. Witness the outstanding work of the top three winners by visiting the link below:

[Check out the top three winners here!]()
